comment.author: 69679868@N03
comment._content:
Evelyn Charles Yorke St Vincent Nepean; b. 24 Nov 1880 at Cottingham, E. Yorkshire; d. 23 Feb 1937 (age 56).  Son of Commander St Vincent Nepean MVO, b. Jul 1844-d. Mar 1915; and Anne Julia Blanch, d. 1935.  Evelyn Nepean was originally a clerk with the Bank of England; he enlisted in 1914 in the Honourable Artillery Company as Gunner No 423; was first shipped to operational theatre in Egypt with HAC arriving 8 Nov 1915; Mentioned in Despatches (Egyptian Expeditionary Force); and Commissioned into the Royal Field Artillery, 11 Aug 1916; won a Military Cross as a 2Lt (in France?); WO 372/14.  Promoted Lt  12 Feb 1918; Lond Gaz 30569.  Temporary Capt while Asst Supt of Phys and Bayonet Trg from 16 Jul 1918 to 6 Feb 1919; Lond Gaz 30855 and 31468. Granted Promotion to Captain and Reliquished Commission 1 Apr 1920.  Lond Gaz 32093.

Evelyn was the youngest of 6 children – having 2 sisters and 3 brothers.  His brother Leonard St V Nepean, b. 2 Feb 1879-d. 20 Jul 1932; was a professional soldier who served in the Boer War 1902 and in North Nigeria 1903-4 with the Imperial Yeomanry.  Leonard served in the First World War as a Captain in 6th Battalion the Manchester Regiment.  Another brother, Charlton St V Nepean, died in May 1914.

comment.author: 32300107@N06
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/69679868@N03] Hi, thank you for the information. Could you tell us where you found it? Many thanks.

comment.author: 69679868@N03
comment._content: Various sources.  From the Library of the Joint Services Command and Staff College: The Army Lists and Burke's Peerage:  From 'on-line' sources; thePeerage.com (Page 23895) which led me to Burke's Peerage;  The London Gazette editions 30569, 30855, 31468 and 32093 as referenced; and The National Archive WO 372/14 as referenced. //
